name: Sumner's conjecture
rephrased: Any tree with n vertices, when oriented (each edge directed), can be found as a subgraph within a tournament of 2n-2 vertices.
implication_form: If a graph is an orientation of an n-vertex tree, then it is a subgraph of every (2n-2)-vertex tournament.
explained: Sumner's conjecture (also known as Sumner's universal tournament conjecture) is a conjecture in extremal graph theory. It states that for any positive integer n and any orientation of any n-vertex tree, this oriented tree is isomorphic to a subtournament of every tournament on 2n-2 vertices.
